etymology.description: 围(圍) (wéi, "surround") + 棋(棋) (qí, "board game") refers to the board game Go, which involves strategic placement of pieces to surround more territory than the opponent.
etymology.interpretation: 围棋(圍棋) (wéiqí, "Go game") literally translates to a board game (棋) where players aim to surround (围) their opponent's pieces to capture territory. It is a traditional and highly strategic Chinese game, known for its rich history and deep complexity.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢围棋(我喜歡圍棋)。
昨天我和朋友下围棋(昨天我和朋友下圍棋)，双方激烈对抗(雙方激烈對抗)。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān wǒ hé péngyǒu xià wéiqí, shuāngfāng jīliè duìkàng.
examples.english: Yesterday, my friend and I played Go, and both sides competed fiercely.

examples.chinese: 围棋不仅锻炼思维(圍棋不僅鍛鍊思維)，还培养耐心(還培養耐心)。
examples.pinyin: Wéiqí bùjǐn duànliàn sīwéi, hái péiyǎng nàixīn.
examples.english: Go not only sharpens the mind, but also develops patience.
